main event: On 23 November 1951, a photograph of an alleged flying saucer was recorded in Riverside, California.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a weather balloon, but the hypothesis was later discarded due to the object's rapid maneuvers,The object was described as metallic or silver in color and approximately 60 feet in diameter,The witness reported the object remained stationary before disappearing at high speed, The case is part of the Project Blue Book archives, which document UFO sightings investigated by the U.S. Air Force,Several credible witnesses observed the object during the sighting.
witness description: William Neeley, Jr., a 28-year-old electronics technician with no history of false reports or mental illness.
